meanings.definition: The quality or state of being sacred or inviolable.
meanings.sent1: The sacrosanctities of the ancient temple were respected by all.
meanings.sent2: In many cultures, certain rituals are considered sacrosanctities.
meanings.sent3: The children played near the forbidden garden, unaware of its sacrosanctities.
meanings.sent4: To him, her trust was a sacrosanctity that he would never betray.
meanings.sent5: The soldier's loyalty to his country was a sacrosanctity he held above all else.

meanings.definition: Things regarded as sacred or inviolable.
meanings.sent1: The tribe's sacred artifacts were their most treasured sacrosanctities.
meanings.sent2: The family heirlooms were considered sacrosanctities by all generations.
meanings.sent3: The cat treated the houseplant as one of its sacrosanctities, always guarding it.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, the old oak tree was a living sacrosanctity of nature.
meanings.sent5: The ancient manuscript was a true sacrosanctity, carefully preserved for centuries.
